author: azuarc

text:
Best thing about this fight: The fact that no side was just evil (like in most JRPGs these days), but the "antagonist" had good reasons for doing what he intended to do. Yuri and co. had good reasons though to stop him too...
...Why can't they make stories and character like these anymore?
(yeah I played and loved Persona 5, but Yuri was an awesome protagonist)
author: Cookie Mamba

text: That's why having an anti-hero (which Kato fits perfectly) in a story is way better than just having a normal villain. It immediately creates a way deeper and more memorable story. Kato is definitely my favorite antagonist ever (in my eyes, only Satan from Milton's poem Paradise Lost, who was basically the first modern anti-hero, can match him), just because he has not even a single ounce of evil in him (unlike Satan in Paradise Lost). Everything he does, he does for a completely understandable reason, considering all the tragedy he had to endure in his personal life, and all the cruelty he saw in the world during the war (and one might even argue that the world would have been a better place if he had succeeded). All that makes him the perfect anti-hero
author: Filip Jovanovic

author: Grissom

text: @Grissom Apparently he didn't. But it doesn't matter as Karen and Yuri were both sent to the past so it still loops the same as before except this time (and I hope) Yuri succeeds on saving Alice.
author: Ocelot-sensei

text: This is the main reason why I prefer Jrpg over western ones. Most western games used to feature the usual absolute good vs absolute evil trope. And in many jRPG we have villains who are only evil depending on perspective, or there was that one villain who became warped into what he became over time, and things like that. Dragon Quest being an obvious exception to that, since it also feature the classic good vs evil battles. IN time we had more elaborate stories in western games and now I can play some of them, but I used to really avoid them.

author: EdoCrabo

text:
@EdoCrabo i actually agree to this and it's called preference.  FF is always the go to when someone mentions JRPG...
I disagree....
Legend of Dragoon
Last Story
Xenoblade Chronicles 
Pandora Tower ( a bit irritating but good)
So many good JRPG's overshadowed and overlooked due to  FF's name alone.  And it's damn near criminal. Hell FF7 Remake is getting praise  DESPITE glaring issues and  the new hype blinding them. i for one cannot help but hate the fact ONE summon PER  BATTLE . No more W- summon and  quadra magic  spam of K.OTR ,  Hell materia aren't born , requiring you to buy more  with already dwindling  pile of gil,  the only thing it is is flashy...jazz hands  to pacify the audience. " It looks good!!" About the only thing it does well honestly. It's flashy,  i didn't realize i was playing FFXV redux.  Hell i am half expecting released DLC of ragnarok having Cloud  use warpstrike.
